nent of the broader audit process that aims at improving the quality of perinatal care and 
perinatal outcomes. 
• The following are achieved through the PNRM
• Reviewing perinatal (including maternal) outcomes.
• Following trends in perinatal indicators.
• Identifying gaps in the provision of quality perinatal care.
• Determining actions to prevent deaths and morbidity from similar causes.
• Identifying progress on action plans identified at the previous meeting.
